M.S. in Hospitality Industry Studies                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                       Tisch Center for Hospitality and Tourism                                                                                           About             History and Mission Faculty University and School Resources News                   Admissions                 Academics             Graduate Programs Undergraduate Program Noncredit Offerings                   Career                 Conferences and Events             NYU Hospitality Conference Distinguished Lecturer Series Career Fair                   Initiatives             Global Initiatives                   Alumni             Alumni Networks Alumni Spotlights Alumni Events                                                     M.S. in Hospitality Industry Studies                                          Graduate Programs ›                M.S. in Hospitality Industry Studies                 Curriculum          Opportunities and Outcomes          Faculty          Admissions Process                   M.S. in Tourism Management            Graduate Certificate in Hospitality Industry Studies            Graduate Certificate in Tourism Management               Undergraduate Program ›           Noncredit Offerings ›                              Ready to Proceed?           Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                                                 M.S. in Hospitality Industry Studies          feature subtitle 1          feature text                                Concentrations           Hotel Finance         Brand Strategy         Lodging Operations         Revenue Management               The hospitality industry includes a number of interrelated businesses–lodging properties, airlines, restaurants, cruise lines, car rental firms, travel agents, and tour operators, among others, and it is growing. By 2014, the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics projects that wage and salary jobs in the hospitality industry will grow by 17 percent. In the United States, travel and tourism are among the nation’s largest services export industries, and one of America’s largest employers. In fact, according to the American Hotel & Lodging Association, hospitality ranks among the top-10 largest industries in 48 states in addition to the District of Columbia.     The M.S. in Hospitality Industry Studies is designed to prepare leaders for working in a dynamic and multifaceted field that is essential to local and regional economies around the world. Coursework includes industry-specific case studies that provide a framework for mastering analytical methods, strategic management, and business principles. The knowledge and skills you gain will enable you to contribute to the profitability, market competitiveness, and effective branding of domestic and international hospitality companies and organizations. You will become familiar with the legal requirements that impact hotel operations, from labor issues and regulations related to national security, to contracts that must be enforceable across different legal systems. You will acquire the expertise to identify opportunities, develop strategies, and implement best-practice models for a single property or a global brand. Integrating the needs of all key stakeholders—clients, employees, corporate partners, shareholders, and host communities—you will learn innovative strategies to guide an organization to success.           Program Locations : 7 East 12th Street              Learn More            NYU School of Professional Studies faculty and staff members look forward to learning more about you, and we want you to learn more about us, to ensure that your decisions regarding your educational experience are well informed. Our admissions staff is here to partner with you throughout the admissions process. Please do not hesitate to contact us .             View General Curriculum               Ready to Proceed? Sustainability                   Distinguished Lecturer Series            Career Fair                           More Links           About the Tisch Center        Tisch Center Blog        Tisch on Twitter                                                                                     NYU International Hospitality Industry Investment Conference                         Conference Information     Date : May 31–June 2, 2015     Location : New York Marriott Marquis  1535 Broadway, New York             Register Now        Plan now to join the global leaders in lodging development, investment, and finance, from May 31–June 2, 2015, at the 37th Annual NYU International Hospitality Industry Investment Conference at the New York Marriott Marquis in New York City.   The Conference hotel room block at the New York Marriott Marquis is now available.   Conference Chair Jonathan M. Tisch and the Executive Planning Committee are in the process of developing another extraordinary program for the 2015 NYU Hospitality Investment Conference.   Registration is now open! You may register online, by mail, or on-site at the Conference. Browse the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) for additional Conference information.                  Ready to Proceed?
